title: Jeff Beck, Tim Bogert & Carmine Appice - Beck, Bogert &

Jeff Beck, Tim Bogert & Carmine Appice - Beck, Bogert & Appice (1973) [EAC-FLAC]

                       Full Artwork @ 300 dpi (jpg) 9MB



Beck, Bogert & Appice were a supergroup power trio consisting of Jeff Beck (The Yardbirds and The Jeff Beck Group), Tim Bogert (Vanilla Fudge, Cactus) and Carmine Appice (Vanilla Fudge, Cactus). The album had solid sales in 1973 and produced a minor hit single with a cover of Stevie Wonder's "Superstition." This would be the band's only studio album, as Beck left the band without warning during the recording of their second album, forcing a sudden dissolution in 1974.
